text.section:
This section does not apply to a retiree who is:
a retiree of:
the State Police Retirement System;
the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System;
the Local Fire and Police System; or
the Employees' Retirement System or the Employees' Pension System, if at the time of retirement the retiree was a law enforcement officer for a participating employer under § 26-201(a) of this article; and
reemployed by a participating employer in any position other than a probationary status law enforcement officer, a law enforcement officer, or chief, as defined in § 3-101 of the Public Safety Article.

The Board of Trustees shall reduce the pension of a retiree on ordinary disability if:
the retiree is under normal retirement age;
the medical board certifies in a report to the Board of Trustees that the retiree is employed by a participating employer at an annual compensation that is greater than the difference between:
the retiree's retirement allowance at retirement; and
the retiree's average final compensation plus $5,000;
the Board of Trustees agrees with the medical board's report; and
the retiree's allowance has not been temporarily suspended as provided in § 29-115 of this subtitle.

The Board of Trustees shall reduce the pension of a retiree who has been receiving an ordinary disability retirement allowance for:
less than 10 years, by $1 for every $2 that the retiree's current compensation exceeds the limit under subsection (b) of this section; or
at least 10 years, by $1 for every $5 that the retiree's current compensation exceeds the limit under subsection (b) of this section.
The pension to be reduced under this section is the pension at retirement without any cost-of-living adjustment.
